{{ infobox officeholder | name = Malek Boutih | office = Member of the [[National Assembly (France)|National Assembly]]
for [[Essonne]]'s [[Essonne's 10th constituency|10th]] constituency | term_start = 17 June 2012 | term_end = 20 June 2017 | predecessor = [[Julien Dray]] | successor = [[Pierre-Alain Raphan]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1964|10|27|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Neuilly-sur-Seine]], [[France]] | nationality = French | party = [[Socialist Party (France)|Socialist Party]] | alma_mater = [[École supérieure de journalisme de Paris]] }} '''Abdelmalek "Malek" Boutih''' ({{IPA-fr|malɛk buˈti}}; born 27 October 1964) is a French retired politician and activist who served as a member of the [[National Assembly (France)|National Assembly]] from 2012 to 2017, representing the [[Essonne]] department. He previously was the [[Socialist Party (France)|Socialist Party]]'s National Secretary for Social Issues (French: ''Secrétaire national chargé des questions de société'') from 2003 to 2008. He also has had a long association with [[SOS Racisme]], a civil rights organisation with close ties to the Socialist Party. He joined in 1984 while a student at the [[Paris Nanterre University|University of Nanterre]] and served as Vice President from 1985 to 1992 and as President from 1999 to 2003. Boutih is known for his honesty and generosity; he is appreciated on both sides of the aisle for his patriotism and frankness. President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] asked him to enter the French Government in 2007 but he refused, preferring to focus on his social activism. == Early life and education == Malek Boutih was born in a clinic in the wealthy neighbourhood of Neuilly-sur-Seine, although his family did not live there. He later chose to return to Neuilly-sur-Seine to attend La Folie-Saint-James high school (''[[Secondary education in France#Lyc.C3.A9e|lycée]]'').{{Cite news|url=http://www.republique-des-lettres.fr/10638-malek-boutih.php|title=Malek Boutih|last=republique-des-lettres.fr|work=republique-des-lettres.fr|access-date=2017-10-31|language=fr-FR}} He was born of [[Algeria]]n parents from [[Kabylie]]. His father was an [[National Liberation Front (Algeria)|FLN]] sympathiser and after independence, his parents went to France seeking work.{{Cite book|title=Paris Alger: Une histoire passionnelle|last=Dubois|first=Christophe|last2=Tabet|first2=Marie-Christine|publisher=Stock|year=2015|isbn=|location=|pages=}} His father worked in the building industry and his mother as a cleaner. At the age of 9 months old he contracted [[poliomyelitis]] while his family was living in the [[slum]]s of [[Nanterre]],{{Cite news|url=http://lirelactu.fr/source/le-parisien/71b76bd0-8923-4fdf-9b14-108af4d2016e|last=Méréo|first=Florence|work=Le Parisien|title=" Ma vie a basculé à cause d'un verre d'eau "|access-date=2017-10-31|language=en}} and later, [[Boulogne-Billancourt]]. He endured multiple operations until the age of 12 years. As a Deputy, he gave financial support to the Antony rehabilitation centre where he was cared for as a child. == Activism == At the beginning of his study of Law at the University of Nanterre and at the ''École supérieure de journalism de Paris'', he became involved in activism and community work. In 1983 he took part in the [[March for Equality and Against Racism]]. Joining SOS Racisme in 1984, he became its vice-president from 1985 to 1992 and founded the [[Grigny, Essonne|Grigny]] ''Maison des Potes'' ("mate's house" — emergency accommodation) and the ''Banlieues du Monde'' association. He was editor-in-chief of the newspaper ''Pote à Pote'' ("Mate to Mate") for several years. On 6 February 1990, he appeared on the TV talk show ''[[Ciel, mon mardi !]]'', a program that specialised in confrontation between people with opposing views. His time as head of SOS Racisme was marked by the creation of the discrimination test and the first convictions in cases against racial [[discrimination]] in employment, housing and entry to night clubs. His greatest triumph being the validation of the use of discrimination tests by the [[Court of Cassation]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.humanite.fr/node/266788|title=La pratique du testing validée par la Cour de cassation|date=2002-06-12|work=[[L'Humanité]]|first=Émilie|last=Rive|access-date=2017-11-02|language=fr}} In the fight against racism and its rooks, he focussed on education at tackled urban ghettos with two priorities: mixing the population and fighting against violence. Finally, in 2002 he was one of the first to sound the alarm on the rise of [[anti-semitism]] in France, in the guise of [[anti-Zionism]].{{Cite news|url=http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/societe/20030326.OBS8611/sos-racisme-sonne-l-alerte.html|title=SOS-Racismesonne l'alerte|work=[[L'Obs]] (Nouvel Observateur)|access-date=2017-11-02|language=fr-FR}} A regular critic of its elder, rival anti-racism organisation [[MRAP]], in 2003 Malek Boutih declared "that there are several kinds of anti-racism in France, notable that of MRAP who march to cries of 'Death to the Jews!'". In September 2006, he was convicted, fined €1,000 and order to pay €1 damages by the Paris [[Tribunal correctionnel (France)|''tribunal correctionel'']] for defamation of MRAP.{{Cite news|url=http://www.liberation.fr/societe/2006/09/15/malek-boutih-condamne-pour-diffamation_51379|title=Malek Boutih condamné pour diffamation|work=[[Libération]].fr|access-date=2017-11-02|language=fr}} He takes a position against separatism, ghetto mentality{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.fr/books?id=4TV2HAAACAAJ&dq=LA+FRANCE+AUX+FRAN%C3%87AIS+?+CHICHE+!&cd=1|title=La France aux Français?: Chiche!|last=Boutih|first=Malek|last2=Lévy|first2=Elisabeth|date=2001|publisher=Mille et une nuits|isbn=9782842055646|language=fr}} and positive discrimination. He states: {{Quote|In France, minorities do not exist! We are not a threatened species. And if we [all] start speaking Arabic or Mandingo, or Breton or Corsican we will break apart the national community. France is the baguette, wine, cheese and now couscous, as well as 'Liberty, Equality, Fraternity'. Two hundred years ago we got a head start in creating a political, rather than ethnic, national identity.''[[Le Figaro]]'' - 10 juillet 2000}} Since the [[Treaty of Lisbon]] came into force on 1 December 2009, there has been a legal basis for the protection of minorities in Europe and hence in France. For Malek Boutih, the children of immigrants have taken root in French society. They are French. To affirm that national identity is a sort of political rallying cry for that generation. Thus he hopes to persuade young people who are French, but have been convinced by the signals they are given (they are blacks, they are Arabs [''Beurs'']…) that they are not French, indeed they cannot even claim to be. According to him, France must finally recognize that integration has well and truly taken place and the country is now of mixed blood. He condemns religious extremism.{{Cite news|url=http://www.histoiresdememoire.org/spip.php?article171|title=Interview de Malek Boutih|last=Sabatier|first=Benoît|date=June 2005|work=Technikart|issue=n°93|language=French|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081226024124/http://www.histoiresdememoire.org/spip.php?article171|archive-date=2008-12-26|access-date=2017-11-02|deadurl=yes|df=}} During his time as head of SOS Racisme, he conducted an ongoing fight against violence in poor suburbs which he branded "self-destructive and nihilist" in his ''Propositions pour un véritable Plan Marshall pour les [[Banlieue]]s'' ("Proposals for a real Marshall Plan for the Suburbs"){{Cite news|url=http://www.herodote.org/article.php3?id_article=94|title=SOS Racisme et les " ghettos des banlieues " : Construction et utilisations d'une représentation|last=Robine|first=Jérémy|date=2004|work=''Hérodote:'' revue de géographie de de géopolitique|access-date=2017-11-02|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090122083811/http://www.herodote.org/article.php3?id_article=94|archive-date=2009-01-22|dead-url=yes|issue=113 - Territoires de Pouvoirs en France (second trimestre 2004)|df=}} because it was preventing the emancipation of a generation and could only end in failure. He refused to support violence as being the only response to marginalisation and preferred political, trade-union and community actions. Only the political commitment of that generation would allow the spiral of violence to end, according to him, and along with it the ethnic and geographic discrimination they suffered. == Politics == A member of the Socialist Party since 1986, when his leadership of SOS Racisme ended he was appointed to the party's national hierarchy at the 2003 [[Dijon Congress|Congress of Dijon]] as National Secretary for Social Issues, a post that did not previously exist, despite never having had an elected position. The post was renewed at the [[Le Mans Congress]] in 2005. He had responsibility for [[immigration]], the fight against racism, AIDS and drug addiction. He wrote a report on immigration, ''Une nouvelle politique de l'immigration'' (2004) ("A new politics of immigration"), called for by the national leadership of the party to define an official line on the subject. His goal was to convince the public that immigration was an essential contribution to France when it was properly controlled and organised. He declared himself in favour of quotas in line with a strategy of [[codevelopment]] creating a legal stream of immigration and regulating flows of migrants. This report was distributed by the Socialist Party leadership.{{Cite news|url=http://www.minorites.org/article.php?IDA%3D17793|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081226022816/http://www.minorites.org/article.php?IDA=17793 |dead-url=yes|archive-date=2008-12-26|title=Malek Boutih: "Chez nous, c'est "Good Bye Lénine" !"|last=Mandraud|first=Isabelle|date=2007-06-25|work=[[Le Monde]]|access-date=2017-11-03}} Following the Le Mans Congress, faced with a social crisis and questions of national identity, he defended the ideal of a "mixed-blood [[Republic]]" (''République métissée''). According to him, {{Quote|It is the mixed-blood Republic that must be the new flag to unite the whole French population, which can make our nation not one that is pointed out because of its unrest, but as a country that, true to its historic tradition, again opens a new page of history which enables bringing people together,…which will lead to a hope in the world which will be an alternative to that shock of civilisations, to the technicalities of religions, to the shock of difference, but more than that to a convergence of aspirations.}}{{Cite web|url=http://congres2005.parti-socialiste.fr/article.php3%3Fid_article=393.html|title=C'est la République métissée qui doit être notre nouveau drapeau.|last=Boutih|first=Malek|date=2005-11-19|website=Congrès du PS au Mans (Parti socialiste)|language=French|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080110090351/http://congres2005.parti-socialiste.fr/article.php3?id_article=393.html|archive-date=2008-01-10|dead-url=yes|access-date=2017-11-03|df=}} Effectively he believes that the Republic is an idea that cannot remain fixed and that it should lean towards an ideal which "brings together the tradition of all that is best in French history, Republican history, but which also looks to the future, which accepts France's place in the world, which accepts the new generations of French people, which accepts diversity not as a handicap but as a treasure". In his report on [[Substance dependence|drug addiction]], ''Cannabis : contrôler l'usage pour protéger les citoyens'' (2006) ("Cannabis: Controlling usage to protect citizens"),{{Cite news|url=http://www.cannaweed.com/news/article-1030-boutih-imagine-nouvelle-filiere-agricole.html|title=Malek Boutih imagine une " nouvelle filière agricole "|last=Mandraud|first=Isabelle|date=2006-06-16|work=[[Le Monde]]|access-date=2017-11-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081226015533/http://www.cannaweed.com/news/article-1030-boutih-imagine-nouvelle-filiere-agricole.html|archive-date=2008-12-26|dead-url=yes|language=French|df=}} Malek Boutih advocates taking public control of the market so as to combat the mafia, cannabis being, according to him, "the cornerstone of [[ghetto]]isation and insecurity in working-class neighbourhoods". This idea was taken into the platform of the Socialist Party in 2007 in the form of "public regulation". Close to [[Julien Dray]], also a former member of SOS Racisme, he supported [[Ségolène Royal]] as Socialist Party candidate in the [[French presidential election, 2007|2007 French Presidential election]]. The new [[President of France|President]], [[Nicolas Sarkozy]], asked him to join his government, which he refused to do,''Sarkozy peaufine son ouverture'', ''[[Libération]]'', {{date|2007-06-16}} affirming that there was no question of him "taking responsibilities in this government", all the while underlining "the reciprocal respect" which characterised his relationship with Nicolas Sarkozy. He was not reappointed to the National Secretariat of the party in December 2008 and was summoned on 25 January 2009 by [[Pouria Amirshahi]] to clarify his attitude after his criticisms of the party's plan for the [[Financial crisis of 2007–2008|financial crisis]] and his numerous accolades of Nicolas Sarkozy. "Malek Boutih should choose which side he's on."{{Cite news|url=http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/actualites/politique/20090125.OBS1372/malek_boutih_accuse_au_ps_detre_le_premier_des_sarkozys.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120715060030/http://tempsreel.nouvelobs.com/actualites/politique/20090125.OBS1372/malek_boutih_accuse_au_ps_detre_le_premier_des_sarkozys.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=15 July 2012|title=Malek Boutih accusé au PS d'être le "premier des sarkozystes"|date=25 January 2009|work=[[L'Obs]]|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}} === 2007 Legislative elections === Malek Boutih was chosen as candidate for the [[Charente's 4th constituency]] in the [[French legislative election, 2007|2007 Legislative elections]] on 1 July 2006 at the national congress of the Socialist Party. Almost all of the elected Socialists in the department made publicly known their hostility to his candidature and their willingness to block him since he was parachuted into the position.''Boutih, un parachuté vilipendé en Charente'', ''[[Libération]]'', {{date|13 July 2006}} The First Federal Secretary had effectively organised a consultative vote in the constituency between candidates [[Martine Pinville]] and Jeanne Filloux, before Malek Boutih's appointment. Selected by the local party members, Martine Pinville chose to keep her candidature with the official support of the Socialist Party, thus she was excluded at the national committee meeting of 22 May 2007, along with her alternate candidate, the outgoing Socialist deputy Jean-Claude Beauchaud. Boutih was eliminated in the first round of the elections, coming third with 15.65% of the vote (9.54% of enrolled voters, although 12.5% was needed to progress to the second round), behind the [[Union for a Popular Movement|UMP]] Mayor of [[Angoulême]], Philippe Mottet (35.58% of the vote) and the dissident Socialist Martine Pinville (21.04%, 13% of enrolled voters). Boutih singled out the First Secretary François Hollande, accusing him of "throwing him to the wolves".''Malek Boutih (PS): «Hollande m'a envoyé au casse-pipe»'', [[Libération]], {{date|11 July 2007}}. In the second round, the Socialist Party supported Martine Pinville who was elected with 57.03% of the vote. He felt that he had been beaten by his own party and severely criticised its leaders "who formed a clique that disliked society as it was, who cannot see themselves as part of it and who cling to the melancholy of the 1970s. Where we come from it's Good Bye Lenin!" He rebuked them for having skimmed over the debate on diversity and not having taken it up seriously, like other subjects of real concern to French people: violence, work, the right to social emancipation, identity. === 2012 Legislative elections === Malek Boutih was chosen as a candidate in [[Essonne's 10th constituency]] following a vote of party members. He began his campaign using the words and images of [[Jean-Luc Mélenchon]] and in his campaign materials, despite Mélenchon supporting [[François Delapierre]], the candidate for the [[Left Front (France)|Left Front]] in the same constituency.{{Cite web|url=http://www.jean-luc-melenchon.fr/2012/05/03/mise-au-point/|title=Communiqué du 03-05-12, Mise au point|website=www.jean-luc-melenchon.fr|date=2012-05-03|access-date=2017-11-03}} He led in the first round on 10 June 2012 with 34.56% of the vote and was elected on 17 June with 56.84% of the vote against the Radical Party candidate, Marianne Duranton (43.16%).{{Cite news|url=http://essonneinfo.fr/91-essonne-info/28123/lessonne-vire-a-gauche/|title=L'Essonne vire à gauche|date=2012-06-18|work=Essonne Info — Site d'actualité et d'information en Essonne|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.assemblee-nationale.fr/14/tribun/fiches_id/610045.asp|title=M. Malek Boutih - Mandat clos - Essonne (10e circonscription) - Assemblée nationale|last=Nationale|first=Assemblée|website=www.assemblee-nationale.fr|language=fr-FR|access-date=2017-11-03}} === Jihadism in France === In February 2015 the [[Prime Minister of France|Prime Minister]] [[Manuel Valls]] named Malek Boutih as parliamentarian assigned to consider the analysis and prevention of "new generations turning to terrorism in connection with [[Jihadism|jihadist]] networks".Lettre de mission du 26 février 2015, citée dans Rapport ''Génération radicale'' This report was handed over in June 2015, titled ''Génération radicale'' ("Radical Generation").{{Cite news|url=http://www.youscribe.com/Product/DownloadFile/2589457?format=1&key=d2064e274c0684e10268c25b4e33d6fac3217e78|title="Génération radicale" : rapport de Malek Boutih sur le djihadisme|last=YouScribe|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/actualite-france/2015/07/02/01016-20150702ARTFIG00404-djihadisme-le-cri-d-alarme-de-malek-boutih.php|title=Djihadisme : le cri d'alarme de Malek Boutih|date=2015-07-02|work=[[Le Figaro]]|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}} One of its major conclusions was: {{Quote|We no longer have the right to doubt, to quibble, to weigh up. The time has come for determined action to enforce the Republican project… Public action in response to radicalism must be part of a plan of counter-attack, giving the Republic all of its strength and all of its appeal.}} Warmly welcomed by members of the opposition, but more discretely by the Socialist majority, this report was criticised especially for its sources, such as [[Frigide Barjot|Frigid Barjot]]{{Cite news|url=http://www.liberation.fr/france/2015/07/03/malek-boutih-dresse-un-tableau-noir-de-la-jeunesse_1342694|title=Malek Boutih dresse un tableau noir de la jeunesse|first=Jérémie|last=Lamothe|work=[[Libération]].fr|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr}} and for the prominence granted to [[Pierre Bellanger]], founder and CEO of radio station [[Skyrock (radio)|Skyrock]] where Boutih worked as Manager of Institutional Relations.{{Cite news|url=http://www.francetvinfo.fr/france/jihadistes-francais/ce-qui-derange-dans-le-rapport-du-depute-malek-boutih-sur-le-jihadisme_987939.html|title=Ce qui dérange dans le rapport du député Malek Boutih sur le jihadisme|date=2015-07-07|work=Franceinfo|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}} For [[Libération]] the report "caricatures young people as thirsty for recognition, radicalised and inured to violence" and the daily laughs at certain suggestions such as creating "night clubs run by associations and publicly financed" to avoid people being turned away. === Socialist Primary and 2017 Legislative election === In between the two rounds of the Socialist Party Primary to select a Presidential candidate, Malek Boutih vehemently attacked [[Benoît Hamon]] maintaining that he would be "in harmony with an [[Islamo-Leftism|Islamo-Leftist]] fringe [to whom] he would make a discreet electoral appeal" and branded him the candidate for ''Indigènes de la République'' (an anti-racist, anti-colonial, anti-Zionist party accused of racism, anti-semitism, homophobia and antifeminism).{{Cite news|url=http://lelab.europe1.fr/islamisme-manuel-valls-justifie-les-attaques-de-malek-boutih-contre-benoit-hamon-2960330|title=Islamisme : Manuel Valls justifie les attaques de Malek Boutih contre Benoît Hamon - Le Lab Europe 1|first=Jérémie|last=Lamothe|work=[[Europe 1|europe1.fr]]|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}} These remarks divided the supporters of Manuel Valls.{{Cite news|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/election-presidentielle-2017/article/2017/01/25/la-strategie-anti-hamon-divise-le-camp-valls_5068854_4854003.html|title=La stratégie anti-Hamon divise le camp Valls|last=Bonnefous|first=Bastien|date=2017-01-25|work=[[Le Monde]].fr|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr|issn=1950-6244}} On 30 March, he announced on [[Europe 1]] that he would support the candidate for [[En Marche!]], [[Emmanuel Macron]], from the first round of the presidential election.{{Cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.fr/2017/03/30/malek-boutih-annonce-son-soutien-a-emmanuel-macron_a_22018141/|title=Malek Boutih annonce qu'il votera Emmanuel Macron|date=2017-03-30|work=Le Huffington Post|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}} In anticipation of the 2017 Legislative elections, he sought nomination as a candidate for ''La République en marche !''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/elections-legislatives-2017/article/2017/05/09/legislatives-le-depute-ps-malek-boutih-sollicite-l-investiture-d-en-marche_5125117_5076653.html|title=Législatives : le député PS Malek Boutih sollicite l'investiture d'En marche !|date=2017-05-09|work=Le Monde.fr|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr|issn=1950-6244}} The nomination was refused and he competed in the election as an independent.{{Cite news|url=http://www.lci.fr/elections/boutih-touraine-valls-el-khomri-ils-ne-sont-pas-investis-par-la-republique-en-marche-pourtant-ils-se-revendiquent-de-la-majorite-presidentielle-2052905.html|title=Boutih, Touraine, El Khomri : ils ne sont pas investis par La République en marche, pourtant ils se revendiquent de la majorité présidentielle|work=LCI|access-date=2017-11-03|language=fr-FR}} He was eliminated in the first round with 12.39% of the vote. == Other posts and honours == Malek Boutih is also an administrator of the ''Collège des personnalités qualifiées du Paris Saint-Germain''.{{Cite web|url=http://www.franceinter.fr/personne-malek-boutih|title=Biographie et actualités de Malek Boutih France Inter|website=France Inter|language=fr-FR|access-date=2017-11-03}} He is Manager of Institutional Relations at the radio station [[Skyrock (radio)|Skyrock]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.strategies.fr/archives/20070105/20070105_18/mamadou-gaye--directeur-des-affaires-publiques-de-skyrock.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110224110821/http://www.strategies.fr/archives/20070105/20070105_18/mamadou-gaye--directeur-des-affaires-publiques-de-skyrock.html |dead-url=yes|archive-date=2011-02-24|title=Mamadou Gaye, directeur des affaires publiques de Skyrock|last=|first=|date=2007-01-05|website=stratégies.fr|language=fr-FR|access-date=2017-11-03}} He received the medal of a knight of the [[National Order of Merit (France)|National Order of Merit]] in 2001. Manhattan Project Chemistry and Physics Section | author_abbrev_bot = | author_abbrev_zoo = | influences = | influenced = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | footnotes = | spouse = | children = }} '''Margaret Dorothy Foster''' (March 4, 1895 – November 5, 1970) was an American chemist. She was the first female chemist to work for the [[United States Geological Survey]], and was recruited to work on the [[Manhattan Project]]. ==Life== She was born in [[Chicago, Illinois]]. Her father was James Edward Foster and mother was Minnie (McAuley) Foster. She graduated from [[Illinois College]], [[George Washington University]] and from [[American University]], with a Ph.D. Beginning in 1918, she became the first female chemist to work on the [[United States Geological Survey]], developing ways to detect minerals within naturally occurring [[body of water|bodies of water]].{{cite book|publisher=Temple University Press|date=2003|title=Their Day in the Sun: Women of the Manhattan Project|author= Ruth H. Howes, Caroline L. Herzenberg|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=Ys0N4rFgt6UC&pg=PA91&lpg=PA91&dq=Margaret+Foster+Manhattan+Project&source=bl&ots=Kr1b4E7Scr&sig=FrmEfXimAgVzyu5Dbn7Ze2_7i2A&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwikj5_0g-jNAhWDfRoKHZVaDpoQ6AEIKTAC#v=onepage&q=Margaret%20Foster%20Manhattan%20Project&f=false|pages=91–2}} In 1942, she worked on the [[Manhattan Project]] in the Chemistry and Physics Section, under Roger C. Wells, developing two new techniques of quantitative analysis, one for [[uranium]] and one for [[thorium]],{{cite web|url=http://siarchives.si.edu/collections/siris_arc_287607|title=Margaret D. Foster (1895-1970)|first1=Foster, Margaret|last1=D|first2=|last2=sysadmin|date=1 January 1919|publisher=}} as well as two new ways to separate the two elements. Upon her return to the Geological Survey after the war, she researched the chemistry of clay minerals and micas. She retired in March 1965.{{cite journal |last=Fahey |first=Joseph J. |date=March–April 1971 |title=Memorial of Margaret D. Foster |url=http://www.minsocam.org/ammin/AM56/AM56_686.pdf |journal=[[American Mineralogist|The American Mineralogist]] |publisher=[[Mineralogical Society of America]] |volume=56 |pages=686–690 |accessdate=28 March 2014}} She died at Holy Cross Hospital, [[Silver Spring, Maryland]]. ==Publications== * {{cite journal |last=Foster |first=Margaret D. |year=1938 |title=The chemist at work. {{Infobox saint |name= Sister Mary of Jesus de León y Delgado, O.P. |birth_date= 23 March 1643 |death_date= 15 February 1731 (aged 87) |feast_day= |venerated_in= Roman Catholic Church
[[Canary Islands]], Spain, & the [[Dominican Order]] |image= La Siervita de Dios.jpg |imagesize= 200px |caption= ''La Siervita'' (The Little Servant) |birth_place= [[El Sauzal]], [[Tenerife]], Spain |death_place= [[San Cristóbal de La Laguna]], Tenerife, Spain |titles= [[Servant of God]]; [[Virgin]] |beatified_date= |beatified_place= |beatified_by= |canonized_date= |canonized_place= |canonized_by= |attributes= Dominican [[religious habit]], a [[rosary]], the image of the [[Baby Jesus]] with [[laurus nobilis|laurel]] |patronage= People who are abducted, against [[child labour]], suffering from [[skin diseases]], against fire, lost and impossible causes and sickness |major_shrine= Monastery of St. Catherine of Siena,
San Cristóbal de La Laguna, Tenerife, Spain |suppressed_date= |issues= |prayer= }} The [[Servant of God]] '''Mary of Jesus de León y Delgado''', [[Dominican Order|O.P.]] ({{lang-es|Sor María de Jesús}}), was a [[Spanish people|Spanish]] [[Dominican Order|Dominican]] [[lay brother|lay sister]], [[Christian mysticism|mystic]] and [[visionary]], known popularly as "La Siervita" (the Little Servant). She lived a life which was austere and simple, and many miracles were attributed to her, as well as [[levitation]], [[ecstasy (emotion)|ecstasy]], [[bilocation]], the [[stigmata]], [[clairvoyance]] and healing, among others.[http://miguelbravo.com/LAGUNAPATRIMONIO/MONJASCATALINAS/SIERVITA/siervitasnotasprensa.pdf Notas sobre la Siervita de Dios]{{es icon}} De León died with a reputation for [[sanctity]] and is one of the most revered of the natives of the [[Canary Islands]], together with [[Peter of Saint Joseph Betancur]] and [[José de Anchieta]]. The cause for her [[canonization]] has been submitted to the [[Holy See]] for review. == Early life == De León was born on March 23, 1643, in the town of [[El Sauzal]], located on the island of [[Tenerife]], one of the Spanish [[Canary Islands]], to Andrés de León y Bello and María Delgado y Perera, a humble family of noble origin, although in decline. She was of possible [[Guanches|Guanche]] ancestry.[http://www.revistacodice.es/publi_virtuales/v_congreso_mujeres/comunicaciones/analisis_iconografico_retrato_la_siervita.pdf Análisis iconográfico del retrato de sor María de Jesús "La Siervita de Dios"] She was their youngest child, having two sisters and a brother. According to the chronicles of the time, she was a woman of delicate features and a sweet face. From an early age, De León showed [[mysticism|mystical]] inclinations, especially in her feelings and great devotion to a miraculous image of the baby Jesus that was in the Church of St. Peter in her hometown. This image supposedly would open the doors of the church for her when she went to pray before it. There was also a laurel tree which would grow only under her care. With the death of De León's father in 1646, poverty overtook the family. Around this time, a couple from mainland Spain, who had relocated to the city of [[San Cristóbal de La Laguna]], where the husband was to practice medicine, had decided that they wanted another child to care for, along with their own child. Her mother, María Delgado, was convinced to give up her daughter by the doctor's wife with the promise of a better life for the child. Two years later, the couple made plans to move to [[New Spain]], with the intention of taking Mary with them. Before this could happen, she was recovered by her birth mother, who had learned of this plan. Delgado, however, died shortly after this, and her daughter was taken in by a good friend of her mother who lived in [[La Orotava]]. When De León was reaching her teenage years, two local woman, who had the reputation of leading simple lives, came to her foster mother, with a letter supposedly from the girl's maternal aunt, Catalina Delgado, which said that she and her husband wished to care for the care, and the bearers should accompany her to their farm. They then took her back to the city of San Cristóbal de La Laguna, where one of them approached a man in a back alley of the city. De León quickly realized that she was in danger and made her escape. She went to her aunt's home, where she was received and cared for by her and her uncle. Living there, De León gradually took over the care of the farm, doing the hardest jobs and organizing its operations. She would rise at dawn and spend the entire day at work, never showing signs of fatigue. Her spiritual qualities soon became apparent, as she treasured solitude and embraced the lowliest work. She led a life of strict penance, wearing the simplest clothing and sleeping on the floor. Over time, the farm flourished and her uncle, Miguel Pérez, felt that she should be the one to inherit their land. He drew up a will for this on 23 March 1665. Mary was torn. She felt a desire to live a religious form of life, one in which she could do the most needed work, living in total poverty, without even the [[dowry]] her inheritance would have provided. Finally she declared her intention to enter a monastery as a [[lay brother|lay sister]], a decision which her aunt and uncle accepted. Initially De León's guardians wanted her to enter the local monastery of the [[Poor Clares]] as the servant of their daughter, a [[choir nun]] in that community. She chose, however, to enter the monastery of the nuns of the [[Second Order (religious)|Dominican Second Order]], although she originally wanted to belong to the Order of [[Discalced Carmelites]], as she was very devoted to their foundress, St. [[Teresa of Ávila|Teresa of Jesus]]. As there had not yet been established any monasteries of the Discalced Carmelite nuns in the Canary Islands, De León entered the Dominican Order, due to a mysterious dream she had.[http://mdc.ulpgc.es/cdm/singleitem/collection/MDC/id/44036 Cuadros históricos de la admirable vida y virtudes de La Sierva de Dios: Sor María de Jesús de León Delgado] [[File:LagunaCatalina01.jpg|thumb|250px|Monastery of St. [[Catherine of Siena]], where Sister Mary of Jesus' remains lie]] ==Entrance to the monastery== In February 1668, De León was admitted to the Dominican Monastery of St. [[Catherine of Siena]] in San Cristóbal de La Laguna, located next to the Plaza del Adelantado in the center of the city, as a lay sister. There she was to care for an elderly nun of the community, Sister Jacobina de San Jerónimo Suárez, O.P. From that point on she would live within the monastery walls until her death, having never left the cloister. It was during this time that many miracles were attributed to her. One particular episode was one in which a [[devotional medal]] with the image of [[Our Lady of Solitude]] which she owned was reassembled spontaneously after having been broken into pieces several days before. Another possible episode of levitation was described by other nuns. As with other mystics, De León experienced [[ecstasy (emotion)|ecstasy]], during which the emission of light could be seen coming from her face. There were also reports of a marked heat emanating from her body, especially when receiving the [[Eucharist]]. De León had a great friendship with the famous pirate [[Amaro Rodríguez Felipe]], popularly known as the corsair "Amaro Pargo", whose sister was also a lay sister in the monastery and who shared a cell with De León. The privateer claimed to have experienced a great miracle through De León. Pargo recounted that he was assaulted by an individual when he was in [[Cuba]]. At the very instant when the attacker would have plunged his dagger into the body of the pirate, the figure of De León appeared, interceding and preventing Pargo's death. This phenomenon, known as ubiquity or [[bilocation]], and associated with many saints, is the capacity to be in two places simultaneously. De León also had a great friendship with the Franciscan friar and mystic [[John of Jesus Hernández y Delgado|Fray Juan de Jesús]], who was her [[spiritual director]] and who gave her much counsel in pursuing the spiritual life. De León died in monastery cloister on 15 February 1731, having lived within its walls for 63 years without leaving. Before her death, she fell into an ecstasy and died keeping a pulse and the pupils of her eyes clear for more than 24 hours. In her side, next to her heart, was found a wound, such as the one which would have been left by the side of Christ. Three years later her body was exhumed and was found incorrupt, whole and flexible. Her palate and tongue were preserved fresh and rosy, and [[jasmine]]-scented blood issued from her mouth. ==Veneration == [[File:Cuerpo Incorrupto de La Siervita de Dios.jpg|thumb|400px|[[Incorruptibility|Incorrupt body]] of religious, Monastery of St. Catherine of Siena.]] De León's [[Incorruptibility|incorrupt]] body is still preserved in the Monastery of St. Catherine, where she lived out her life and died. Every 15 February (the anniversary of her death), her body is placed on public display in a glass-covered coffin, which was donated by the pirate Amaro Pargo, who was present at the exhumation. Because of the large numbers of pilgrims and devotees who desire to see her incorrupt body, the coffin is also displayed on the following Sunday. A formal inquiry into De León's life for possible canonization was begun in the 19th century, but soon ceased. The cause was reopened in 1992 and has been submitted to the [[Holy See|Vatican]]. It remains pending. Supporters of her cause are dismayed by this lack of progress, despite a document from 1771 which lists 1,251 miracles attributed to her intercession.{{cite journal|url=http://www.eldia.es/2011-02-15/LAGUNA/4-Sor-Maria-Jesus-aun-espera-milagro-beatifique.htm|work=El Día|date=15 February 2011|title=Sor María de Jesús aún espera por el milagro que la beatifique|last=Barbuzano|first=D.|accessdate=17 December 2012|language=es}} Although she has not yet been officially canonized, veneration of Sister Mary of Jesus has become the equivalent in the [[Canary Islands]] in cult of [[Teresa of Ávila|Saint Teresa of Jesus]] in the rest of [[Spain]], [[Saint Catherine of Siena]] in [[Italy]] and [[Rose of Lima|Saint Rose of Lima]] in [[Peru]] and [[Latin America]].{{cn|date=June 2018}} == Miracles == Miracles associated with De León are: *'''Levitation:''' The ability to maintain stable suspension in the air, and was described by several nuns of the monastery. *'''Ecstasy:''' Is an experience of the divine, to feel the presence of God. La Siervita experienced this miracle several times, even as she lay dying. *'''Bilocation:''' The ability to be in two places simultaneously. De León was credited with saving his life by the pirate Amaro Rodríguez through her sudden appearance during an assault on him while he was in [[Cuba]]. *'''Hyperthermia:''' A remarkable elevation of body temperature and the emission of light from the head or face. *'''Clairvoyance:''' The nun came to prophesy her own abduction, a great flood and an eruption of the [[Teide]] volcano, among others.[http://eldia.es/2012-02-18/PRENSA/1-Candelaria-sor-Maria-Jesus-Siervita.htm La Candelaria de sor María de Jesús, la Siervita]{{es icon}} *'''Stigmata:''' When she died, a wound as if by a [[lance]] was found by her heart. *'''Psychokinesis:''' Ability to move objects by an invisible force. == Bibliography == * {{cite book | last=García Barbusano| first= Domingo| authorlink = Domingo Barbusano García| year = 1990 | title = Sor María de Jesús: la monja incorrupta del convento de Santa Catalina de La Laguna | publisher = Edited by the Convent of Santa Catalina de Siena in La Laguna| isbn = 84-4046-866-0 |url =}} * {{cite book | last=Rodríguez Moure| first= José| authorlink = José Rodríguez Moure| year = 2005 | title = Cuadros históricos de la admirable vida y virtudes de La Sierva de Dios: Sor María de Jesús de León Delgado | publisher = Editorial Artemisa| isbn = 84-9637-415-7 |url =}} == See also == * [[List of saints of the Canary Islands]] * [[Amaro Rodríguez Felipe]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == {{Commons category|María de León Bello y Delgado}} *[http://6865.blogcindario.com/2007/02/02597-la-siervita-de-dios-el-sorprendente-caso-de-sor-maria-de-jesus.html La Siervita de Dios.] *[http://www.eldia.es/2007-12-20/norte/norte10.htm Una casa museo para La Siervita], El Día. *[http://www.eldia.es/2005-02-15/laguna/laguna4.htm El convento de Santa Catalina expone hoy el cuerpo de la Siervita]. El Día. *[https://web.archive.org/web/20100106154453/http://odisur.es/index.php?mod=articulos&secc=articulos&id=1825 Congrega miles de devotos en el Monasterio de Santa Catalina. Odisur.] {{Canonization}} {{Subject bar |portal1= Biography |portal2= Catholicism |portal3= Spain}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leon y Delgado, Mary of Jesus de}} [[Category:1643 births]] [[Category:1731 deaths]] [[Category:17th-century Christian mystics]] [[Category:18th-century Christian mystics]] [[Category:People from Tenerife]] [[Category:Dominican Sisters]] [[Category:Dominican mystics]] [[Category:Dominican spirituality]] [[Category:Spanish Roman Catholic religious sisters and nuns]] [[Category:Venerated Catholics]] [[Category:Incorrupt saints]] [[Category:Spanish Servants of God]] [[Category:Stigmatics]] [[Category:Burials in the Province of Santa Cruz de Tenerife|Santa Cruz de Tenerife]]

{{Use American English|date=May 2016}} {{Infobox sportsperson| | name = Mason Abbiate | image = | imagesize = | caption = | fullname = | nicknames = | nationality = American | club = | collegeteam = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|6|24}} | birth_place = California, United States
| sport = Soccer / Cerebral palsy soccer | residence = San Diego, California | education = Del Norte High School | death_place = | height = {{height|m=1.65}} | weight = {{convert|61|kg|lb|abbr=on}} | medaltemplates=<!-- {{MedalSport | Paralympic 7-a-side football}} {{MedalCompetition|[[Paralympic Games]]}} {{MedalSilver | | Men's }}--> | updated = 18 June 2016 }}
'''Mason Abbiate''' (born June 24, 1998) is an American Paralympic soccer player. Abbiate has [[cerebral palsy]], and plays both CP football and able-bodied football. On the able-bodied side, he played for the San Diego Soccer Club and varsity high school soccer for [[Del Norte High School (San Diego, California)|Del Norte High School]].
In January 2015, Abbiate had his first call up to the US Paralympic National Team. Later that year, he was with the team at the 2015 Cerebral Palsy Football World Championships and the 2015 Parapan American Games. He was involved with a number of other training camps and tournaments in the lead up to the [[2016 Summer Paralympics]].
== Personal == Abbiate was born on June 24, 1998<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://results.toronto2015.org/PRS/en/football-7/athlete-profile-n10199045-abbiate-mason.htm|title=ABBIATE Mason|last=|first=|date=2015|website=ParaPan American Games|publisher=TORONTO 2015 Pan Am / Parapan Am Games, 2015|access-date=May 21, 2016}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://www.teamusa.org/para-soccer/athletes/Mason-Abbiate|title=Mason Abbiate|last=|first=|date=2016|website=Team USA|publisher=US Olympic Committee|access-date=June 18, 2016}}</ref> and is from San Diego, California.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2016/03/03/16/08/160303-pnt-paralympic-team-heads-to-chula-vista-for-training-camp|title=U.S. PARALYMPIC TEAM HEADS TO CHULA VISTA FOR TRAINING CAMP|last=|first=|date=March 3, 2016|website=U.S. Soccer|publisher=U.S. Soccer|access-date=May 15, 2016}}</ref> Born four months premature, he weighed only two pounds. He has a mild form of cerebral palsy that impacts the right side of his body. When he was a baby, doctors cautioned his parents that he may never be able to walk.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://www.pomeradonews.com/news/2015/aug/19/athlete-week-miracle-baby-living-dream/|title=Athlete of the Week: 'Miracle baby' living a dream|last=Bower|first=Michael|date=August 19, 2015|work=San Diego Union-Tribune|access-date=May 21, 2016|via=}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=http://hs.utpreps.com/news_article/show/550750|title='Miracle baby' joins Paralympic team|last=Bowers|first=Michael|date=September 5, 2015|work=San Diego U-T Preps|access-date=May 21, 2016|via=}}</ref> He attended [[Del Norte High School (San Diego, California)|Del Norte High School]].<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" />
Abbiate is 165 cm tall and weighs 61 kilograms.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":4" />
== Soccer == Abbiate started playing soccer when he was 6 years old against other players without disabilities.<ref name=":1" /> He played for the San Diego Soccer Club for various age level teams.<ref name=":5">{{Cite web|url=http://www.sandiegosoccerclub.org/home/862260.html|title=SDSC's Mason Abbiate Named to US Paralympic National Soccer Team!|last=|first=|date=2016|website=San Diego Soccer Club|publisher=San Diego Soccer Club|access-date=June 18, 2016}}</ref> He also played varsity high school soccer for [[Del Norte High School (San Diego, California)|Del Norte High School]].<ref name=":4" />
== Cerebral palsy football == Abbiate is a CP7 classified footballer<ref name=rostersalou/> who plays in the midfield.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
Abbiate was selected for the national team after San Diego Soccer Club Director Brian Quinn connected him with the right people.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":1" /> In January 2015, he was invited along with seven other youth players from around the country between the ages 14–19 to participate in a national team development camp at the Chula Vista Olympic Training Center.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" /> Of the players participating in the camp, he was the only one to earn a call up to the national team squad.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" /> He was invited to a national team training camp that took place from April 29 to May 6, 2015 in Carson, California. This camp was in preparation for the 2015 Cerebral Palsy Football World Championships in June of that year in England.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":1" /><ref name=":1" /><ref name="carsoncamp">{{Cite news|url=http://www.socceramerica.com/article/63483/us-paralympic-team-prepping-for-world-championsh.html|title=U.S. Paralympic team prepping for world championship|last=Woitalla|first=Mike|date=April 27, 2015|work=Soccer America Daily|access-date=May 15, 2016|via=}}</ref>
Abbiate went with the team to participate in a tournament in Portugal in early 2015.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" /><ref name=":5" /> In March 2015, he was part of the 14 man roster that participated in the Povoa de Varzim, Portugal hosted Footie 7 – Povoa 2015 tournament.<ref name=":02">{{Cite web|url=http://rushsoccer.com/en/86-front-page-stories/301-keith-johnson-us-paralympic-national-team|title=KEITH JOHNSON – US PARALYMPIC NATIONAL TEAM|last=|first=|date=September 1, 2015|website=Rush Soccer|publisher=|access-date=May 21, 2016}}</ref> The competition was a warmup for the World Championships that were held in England in June 2015.<ref name=":02" /> He was on the roster for the 2015 World Championships. The United States finished seventh at the tournament.<ref name=":1" /> He was a starter in the team's 10 - 0 loss to England.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/disability/2015/jun/england-v-usa-match-report-200615|title=England booked an intriguing final Cerebral Palsy World Championships fixture against the Republic of Ireland, after a commanding 10-0 victory against USA.|last=Reid|first=Jamie|date=June 26, 2015|website=The FA|publisher=|access-date=May 21, 2016}}</ref> He sat on the bench in the United States's 2 - 1 win against Scotland.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.soccerwire.com/news/nt/international-men/u-s-paralympic-national-team-completes-comeback-for-2-1-win-over-scotland/|title=U.S. Paralympic National Team completes comeback for 2-1 win over Scotland|last=U.S. Soccer|first=|date=June 20, 2015|work=Soccer Wire|access-date=May 21, 2016|via=}}</ref> It was his first World Championships as a member of the national team.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.teamusa.org/US-Paralympics/Features/2015/June/16/US-Paralympic-National-Team-heads-to-cerebral-palsy-soccer-world-champs|title=U.S. Paralympic National Team heads to cerebral palsy football world championships|last=U.S. Soccer|first=|date=June 16, 2015|work=U.S. Soccer|access-date=May 21, 2016|via=}}</ref>
Abbiate was part of the 14 man squad that represented the United States at the 2015 Parapan American Games in Toronto. There, the United States played Canada, Venezuela, Argentina and Brazil.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.soccernation.com/uspnt-roster-for-the-2015-parapan-american-games/|title=USPNT ROSTER FOR THE 2015 PARAPAN AMERICAN GAMES|last=|first=|date=August 6, 2015|work=Soccer Nation|access-date=May 15, 2016|via=}}</ref> He played in the United States' 0 - 6 loss to Brazil at the Parapan Games.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.nationalpost.com/sports/brazilians-have-no-peers-at-2015-parapan-am-soccer-events|title=Brazilians have no peers at 2015 Parapan Am soccer events|last=Faris|first=Nick|date=August 13, 2015|work=National Post|access-date=May 15, 2016|via=}}</ref> The national team finished the competition with an 0 - 3 - 1 record.<ref name=":1" />
Going into national team preparations for the Rio Games, Abbiate was the youngest member of the US squad.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3" /> He took part in a national team training camp in Chula Vista, California in early March 2016.<ref name=":0" /> In April 2016, he took part in a national team training camp in Bradenton, Florida in preparation for the May 2016 Pre Paralympic Tournament.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nbcsandiego.com/news/sports/San-Diegans-Garza-Abbiate-Named-to-Paralympic-Team-Training-Camp-Roster-374390641.html|title=San Diegans Garza, Abbiate Named to Paralympic Team Training Camp Roster|last=Schildhouse|first=Becki|date=April 2, 2016|work=NBC San Diego|access-date=May 15, 2016|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2016/03/23/18/59/160323-pnt-head-coach-stuart-sharp-names-16-player-roster-for-april-training-camp|title=PNT HEAD COACH STUART SHARP NAMES 16-PLAYER ROSTER FOR APRIL TRAINING CAMP|last=|first=|date=March 23, 2016|website=|publisher=US Soccer|access-date=June 18, 2016}}</ref> He was part of the [[United States national 7-a-side football team|United States Paralympic National Team]] that took part in the 2016 Pre Paralympic Tournament in [[Salou]], [[Spain]].<ref name="rostersalou">{{Cite web|url=http://media.wix.com/ugd/ec86d3_605daf1002c543fbb466a4d9298f8bf5.pdf|title=United States — Roster|last=|first=|website=IFCPF|publisher=IFCPF|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref> The United States finished 6th after beating Argentina in one placement match 4 - 3 and losing to Ireland 4 - 1. The goals scored in the match against Argentina were the first the USA scored in the tournament, before putting up one more in their match against Ireland.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ifcpf.com/tournaments/match/171|title=Ireland — USA|last=|first=|website=IFCPF|publisher=IFCPF|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ifcpf.com/tournaments/match/170|title=USA — Argentina|last=|first=|website=IFCPF|publisher=IFCPF|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ifcpf.com/tournaments/match/169|title=Argentina — Ireland|last=|first=|website=IFCPF|publisher=IFCPF|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref> The tournament featured 7 of the 8 teams participating in Rio. It was the last major preparation event ahead of the Rio Games for all teams participating.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ifcpf.com/tournaments/international-tournament-schedule|title=Schedule|last=|first=|website=IFCPF|publisher=IFCPF|access-date=15 May 2016}}</ref>

{{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = Mbuvi | image = Mbuvi.JPG | image_size =200px | caption = Mbuvi in 2013 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Victor Mbuvi | alias = | origin = [[Kenya]] | instrument = | genre = [[Christian]], [[Gospel music]] | occupation = | years_active = 2000-present | label = Kivevelo Records | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = | past_members = }}
'''Mbuvi''' is a [[Kenyan]] award-winning [[contemporary gospel]] [[singer]], [[comedian]], [[Philanthropist]] and [[TV presenter]].<ref>http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/?articleID=2000085448&story_title=overflowing-with-talent</ref> Born Victor Mbuvi, he drew his love for music from his childhood and inspiration from his mother who died in 1999, a year before Mbuvi launched his music career. Mbuvi joined a group called His Image, who performed a cappella and various renditions of other artistes’ works.<ref>http://www.kenyangospel.com/news/over-decade-and-still-going-strong</ref> We even modernised a [[Luo people of Kenya and Tanzania|Luo]] [[gospel music|gospel]] [[folk song]] Niwara Nono. In 2001, he briefly teamed up with music producer R Kay and a friend to form Injili Group, which recorded ''Nisamehe'' - his first ever hit song.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://zuqka.com/blog/mbuvi-ive-been-through-a-lot/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-07-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130708152336/http://zuqka.com/blog/mbuvi-ive-been-through-a-lot/ |archivedate=2013-07-08 |df= }}</ref>
==Background== Mbuvi went to Kionyweni Primary School in [[Machakos County]], and then moved to Unity Primary in Umoja Estate in [[Nairobi]] when his parents got transfers. His father worked as an [[auditor]] and his mother was a [[banker]]. He later joined [[Lenana School]], where he played [[rugby football|rugby]]. He then joined [[Moi University]] for a [[Bachelor of Science]] degree in [[Physics]] and later pursued a [[Master’s degree]] in [[Computer]] Based [[Information Systems]], at the [[University of Sunderland]], UK.
Mbuvi however decided to pursue his music career instead of what he had studied.<ref>http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/?articleID=2000085448&story_title=victor-mbuvi-of-the-kwat-kawaya-fame-overflowing-with-talent&pageNo=3</ref><ref>http://www.ghafla.co.ke/news/music/item/3805-mbuvi-goes-back-to-the-kwata-kawaya-style-in-his-new-video-check-out-the-trailer</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://zuqka.com/blog/mbuvi-ive-been-through-a-lot/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-07-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130708152336/http://zuqka.com/blog/mbuvi-ive-been-through-a-lot/ |archivedate=2013-07-08 |df= }}</ref>
==Awards== *[[Kisima Music Awards|2011 Kisima Music Awards]], Benga Artiste of the Year *Groove Awards, Eastern Song of the Year (2010) *Groove Awards, Traditional Song of the Year (2009) *[[Kisima Music Awards]], Ethnic Fusion Artiste of the year (2008) *[[Kisima Music Awards]], R&B Artiste of the Year (2005)<ref>http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/?articleID=2000085448&story_title=victor-mbuvi-of-the-kwat-kawaya-fame-overflowing-with-talent&pageNo=2</ref>
==TV Hosting== In 2008, Mbuvi hosted a TV called "The Day" on DSTV channel 311.<ref>http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/?articleID=2000085448&story_title=victor-mbuvi-of-the-kwat-kawaya-fame-overflowing-with-talent&pageNo=2</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Infobox murderer | name=Francis T. Featherstone | image= | caption= | birth_name=Francis T. Featherstone | nationality =American | criminal_charge=[[Murder]], [[Racketeering]] | conviction_status=[[Parole]]d | alias=Mickey | motive=[[Organized crime]] | allegiance =[[Westies]] | occupation = [[Irish Mob|Mobster]] | birth_date={{birth date and age|1948|9|2}} | birth_place=[[Manhattan]], [[New York (state)|New York]] | country=USA | states=[[New York (state)|New York]] | beginyear=1971 | endyear=1986 | apprehended=1986 | penalty=Five years probation }} '''Francis T. "Mickey" Featherstone''' (born September 2, 1948) is a former [[Irish Mob|Irish American mobster]] and member of [[the Westies]], an [[organized crime]] syndicate from [[Hell's Kitchen, Manhattan|Hell's Kitchen]], [[Manhattan]] in [[New York City]], led by [[James Coonan]]. Featherstone committed several mob killings before he was convicted in 1986 of a murder he had not committed. Facing almost 25 years in jail, he became an informant and brought down Coonan's gang.
==Early life== Featherstone was born on West 43rd St.,<ref name=lords/> one of nine children.<ref name=ghosts>{{cite news|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=oucCAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA38|title=The Ghosts of Hell's Kitchen|last=Daly|first=Michael|author2=John Hamill|date=12 April 1982|work=New York Magazine|accessdate=11 January 2011}}</ref> His mother helped with the [[Veterans of Foreign Wars]] and his father was a [[United States Customs Service]] officer.<ref name=ghosts/> He had blond hair and was often said to be baby-faced.<ref name=lords/> He served in the [[Vietnam War]] as member of the [[Green Berets]] aged just 17 after lying about his age.<ref name=lords/> He served as a stock clerk.<ref name=vicious>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1990/04/16/books/books-of-the-times-the-rise-and-fall-of-a-thoroughly-vicious-gang.html?pagewanted=2&src=pm|title=Books of The Times; The Rise and Fall of a Thoroughly Vicious Gang|last=Raab|first=Selwyn|date=16 April 1990|work=New York Times|accessdate=11 January 2011}}</ref> To his disappointment, he did not see combat, although he was circumcised by his friends in a drunken prank.<ref name=vicious/><ref name=stories>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1990/04/08/books/new-york-stories-hell-s-kitchen-killers.html|title=New York Stories: Hell's Kitchen Killers|last=Bain|first=David Haward|date=8 April 1990|work=New York Times|accessdate=11 January 2011}}</ref> He received a [[military discharge|medical discharge]] in 1967 after just a year, claiming to have hallucinations.<ref name=lords/><ref name=ghosts/>
==Return to Hell's Kitchen== When a group from New Jersey entered Hell's Kitchen called the Riley brothers a fight started with the outsiders, Featherstone returned with a rifle and shot one of the brothers John Riley in the arm, for which he was arrested and probationed.<ref name=ghosts/> He shot dead Linwood Willis in a confrontation outside a bar in 1971, but was found not guilty due to insanity.<ref name=lords/> He spent time in a series of [[mental hospitals]], being released in 1975. He would act out frequently while in the hospitals, leading to him being restrained and injected with [[thorazine]].<ref name=lords/><ref name=ghosts/> He began spending time in saloons like Club 596 and Sunbrite that were hangouts for the Westies.<ref name=ghosts/>
==The Westies== Featherstone's penchant for violence and intimidation caught the eye of Coonan and Featherstone became Coonan's right-hand man by 1976.<ref name=stories/> [[Mickey Spillane (mobster)|Mickey Spillane]], the mob leader in Hell's Kitchen at the time, was shot five times outside his apartment in August 1977, and Featherstone was arrested but acquitted for his killing.<ref name=ghosts/> The police suspected him of a series of mob [[contract killing]]s. He went on trial with Coonan for the killing of a barman, but they were acquitted in December 1979 after one witness killed himself and another refused to testify.<ref name=ghosts/> He was finally jailed after using fake currency at a massage parlor - he was traced because the girl remembered seeing his name tattooed on his forearm. Featherstone did time in the Medical Center for Federal Prisoners in Springfield Missouri on the psychiatric ward in 1982. He was a model prisoner, seen daily picking fine lint off of his perfectly made bunk to pass inspection, and starting arguments with others for not polishing their door frame brass. The institution kept Featherstone working on the ward, out of General Population, for his own safety. In February 1982, he was sentenced to six years in jail for counterfeiting.<ref name=ghosts/>
Featherstone and Coonan had a falling out over the latter's alliance with the [[Gambino crime family]], which Featherstone saw as a betrayal of all the Irish-Americans in Hell's Kitchen.<ref name=stories/>
===Turning informer=== Featherstone was convicted in March 1986 for the April 1985 murder of Michael Holly, despite being innocent of this particular murder, which was a revenge attack probably carried out by another of the Westies, [[Billy Bokun]].<ref name=lords>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1987/04/05/magazine/the-lord-s-of-hell-s-kitchen.html?src=pm|title=The Lords of Hell's Kitchen|last=Traub|first=James|date=5 April 1987|work=New York Times|accessdate=11 January 2011}}</ref> He was shocked at receiving his sentence of 25 years in prison, and concluded that he had been framed by his own gang.<ref name=lords/> Rather than serving his sentence he instead told prosecutors that Bokun had committed the murder, and he became an [[informant]].<ref name=lords/><ref name=informed>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1989/01/01/nyregion/admitted-westies-killer-who-informed-is-free.html|title=Admitted Westies Killer Who Informed Is Free|last=Lubasch|first=Arnold H.|date=1 January 1989|work=New York Times|accessdate=11 January 2011}}</ref> His wife Sissy co-operated with the District Attorney's office to tape incriminating conversations with gang members, including Bokun.<ref name=lords/> In September 1986, Judge [[Alvin Schlesinger]] overturned Featherstone's conviction.<ref name=lords/> His testimony at Coonan's racketeering trial during 1987-8 helped to bring down Coonan's gang.<ref name=stories/> He pleaded guilty to a [[racketeering]] charge and received a suspended sentence of five years probation from Judge [[Robert W. Sweet]] due to his cooperation with the authorities.<ref name=informed/> He was freed in December 1988<ref name=informed/> and went into a [[witness protection]] program.<ref name=informed/>
==References== {{reflist}}
==Further reading== *Davis, John H. ''Mafia Dynasty: The Rise and Fall of the Gambino Crime Family''. New York: HarperCollins, 1993. *[[T.J. English|English, T.J.]] ''The Westies''. St. Martin's Paperbacks, 1991. {{ISBN|0-312-92429-1}} *_____. ''Paddy Whacked: The Untold Story of the Irish American Gangster''. New York: HarperCollins Publishers Inc., 2005. {{ISBN|0-06-059003-3}} *Mustaine, Gene. ''Murder Machine''. Onyx Books, 1993
